title: ‘Fight Club’ No Longer Ends With a Whimper in China Following Explosion Over Censorship
sub_head: Chinese video platform quietly restores 1999 cult film’s conclusion, but 2005’s ‘Lord of War’ still comes with new, harmonious ending
body:
Cult film “Fight Club” once again concludes with a bang for Chinese viewers after a streaming video platform quietly took down a version that ended on a jarringly pro-government note.
Users of Tencent Holdings Ltd. ’s video-streaming service who watch the 1999 David Fincher movie can now see Edward Norton holding Helena Bonham Carter’s hand as buildings crumble in a symphony of explosions.
